title: Parents' climate guilt: 'I haven't been able to give up travel, plastic, beef or Nutella. I can't explain this inconsistency to myself nor to my children'
summary: Climate change is forcing us to look to the future. For some parents, it's time to address their environmental debt to their children.

title: New Caledonia's nickel: Key resource for archipelago and pro-independence movement
summary: The sector accounts for a quarter of direct and indirect employment, but it has been devastated by the cost of energy. For the pro-independence movement, control of this resource remains crucial to achieving full sovereignty.

title: For Palestinian citizens of Israel, commemorations of 1948 Nakba come with stigma
summary: The October 7 attack has increased mistrust of Israel's Palestinian community, which represents 20% of its population. Most demonstrations in solidarity with Gaza its members have tried to organize have been banned or dispersed.

title: A Swiss summit for an unlikely peace in Ukraine
summary: Swiss diplomacy is trying to convince as many countries as possible to take part in a 'peace conference' on June 15 and 16. Although the meeting is unlikely to result in any concrete progress, it will be an opportunity for Bern to improve its image.

title: UN says 800,000 people displaced since start of Israel's Rafah incursion
summary: Philippe Lazzarini, head of the UN Agency for Palestinian Refugees, said that people have been 'forced to flee' to areas without water supplies or adequate sanitation.

title: Paris 2024: Olympic torch relay begins with popular success
summary: The first 10 days of the torch's route, which began in Marseille on May 9, have been better attended than the authorities had forecast.

title: Ukraine's post-25 enlistment policy aims to 'protect the country's future'
summary: Due to declining demographics, the country has chosen not to draft 18-25-year-olds into the armed forces. The average age in the armed forces is over 40.

title: Georgia's president vetoes 'foreign influence' law, but Parliament can override
summary: The ruling party has enough seats to overrule President Salome Zurabishvili's veto of the controversial law based on Russian legislation.

title: Xi and Putin: A far from self-evident friendship
summary: The Chinese and Russian leaders frequently communicate directly and have a strong personal relationship, despite their dissimilar backgrounds.

title: After the arson attack on Rouen's synagogue, shock and support for France's Jewish community
summary: The man who set fire to the building on Friday morning was killed by police. He was an undocumented Algerian whose application for a residency permit in France for health treatment had been rejected. Rallies were held in Rouen and Paris.

title: New Caledonia removed from Olympic torch's route following unrest
summary: The French territory in the Pacific Ocean is under a state of emergency since violent clashes have broken out as French lawmakers adopted a constitutional reform to change voter lists there.

title: Slovak PM's prognosis 'positive,' as shooting suspect in pre-trial detention
summary: Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico, who was shot four times on Wednesday, is in 'stable' condition after undergoing more surgery on Friday, said the health minister.

title: Paris jeweller's near Champs-Elysées robbed by armed men
summary: The three men fired a warning shot but no one was injured, as they escaped with jewels from Harry Winston.

title: New Caledonia: Partial calm but gunfire in French territory under state of emergency
summary: A sixth person was killed in the archipelago on Saturday, following an exchange of fire in the North Province.

title: Delivery of aid to Gaza by sea is a 'smokescreen' given the scale of the needs
summary: The floating pier set up by the United States became operational on Friday, at a time when the Israeli army forced more than 600,000 people to leave the southern city of Rafah in chaos and particularly difficult sanitary conditions.

title: New Caledonia: Why are there so many guns in the French Pacific territory?
summary: French authorities estimate that there is one firearm for every four inhabitants on the archipelago's main island, Grande Terre.

title: Heavy rains in Northern Europe cause floods
summary: There was flooding in parts of Germany, Belgium and the Netherlands.

title: Georgia's 'Family Purity Day': A show of support for the government
summary: Tens of thousands of people marched in Tbilisi on Friday for this celebration organized by the Orthodox Church. It was the government's way of responding to demonstrations against its 'foreign influence' bill.
